src:
S kolesom po Karavankah
V okviru projekta Alpe Adria Karavanke/Karawanken so odprli turnokolesarsko pot Trans Karavanke in Gorskokolesarski učni center Pristava; na čezmejnem območju Karavank so v Žirovnici dobili adrenalinsko kolesarsko progo Predigra.
02 Nov 2019, 18:42 by Primož Hieng



Ob poti so številne naravne in kulturne znamenitosti.



Predsednik PZS Jože Rovan (v sredini) ter turnokolesarska vodnika Andrej Remškar in Atila Armentano ob odprtju poti Trans Karavanke



Primerna je za kondicijsko dobro pripravljene gorske kolesarje.


Nova turnokolesarska pot Trans Karavanke se razteza od Jezerskega do Tromeje oziroma Korenskega sedla, označena in vozna je tudi v nasprotni smeri. Večinoma poteka po gozdnih cestah na prisojnih pobočjih Karavank, do grebena in meje z Avstrijo se povzpne le na najzahodnejši točki na Peči oziroma Tromeji.Pri ureditvi in označevanju poti na terenu so se izkazali markacisti PZS in preostali prostovoljci lokalnih planinskih društev. V Žirovnici se veselijo tudi nove adrenalinske kolesarske proge Predigra. Trojček kolesarskih pridobitev je nastal pod okriljem triletnega projekta Alpe Adria Karavanke/Karawanken, ki združuje 12 partnerjev, sedem iz Slovenije in pet iz Avstrije.


Predsednik PZS Jože Rovan (v sredini) ter turnokolesarska vodnika Andrej Remškar in Atila Armentano ob odprtju poti Trans Karavanke

»Na 132 kilometrih, ki so razdeljeni v pet etap, turnokolesarska pot Trans Karavanke premaga 5500 višinskih metrov. Z Jezerskega nas popelje prek planin pod Košuto proti Tržiču, od tam čez Zelenico v dolino Završnice in na planine pod Stolom, nadaljujemo nad Jesenicami prek Javorniškega Rovta in Planine pod Golico proti Mojstrani, v zadnjem delu pa gremo po Zgornjesavski dolini do Rateč in se vzpnemo še na Peč,« je traso orisal turnokolesarski vodnik Andrej Remškar. Pot med drugim obišče Slovenski planinski muzej v Mojstrani ter nekaj priljubljenih planinskih koč: Dom na Kofcah, Planinski dom na Zelenici, Valvasorjev dom pod Stolom in dom Pristava v Javorniškem Rovtu.
V Žirovnici se veselijo nove adrenalinske kolesarske proge Predigra.
»Ob poti srečamo številne naravne in kulturne znamenitosti: proti Tržiču se peljemo skozi Dovžanovo sotesko, nato skozi tržiško staro mestno jedro, v dolini Završnice gremo ob Završniškem jezeru, ob vzponu na Zabreško planino mimo Turške jame, blizu je arheološko nahajališče Ajdna. Nad Planino pod Golico lahko obiščemo Savske jame, v Zgornjesavski dolini pa velja omeniti vsaj še Zelence, kjer izvira Sava Dolinka. Kljub vsem znamenitostim bodo za kolesarje največja nagrada čudoviti razgledi in uživanje v neokrnjeni naravi,« dodaja Remškar.


Primerna je za kondicijsko dobro pripravljene gorske kolesarje.

»Pot je primerna za kondicijsko dobro pripravljene gorske kolesarje, saj so dnevne etape praviloma dolge od 25 do 35 kilometrov, največ pa v enem dnevu premagamo 1650 višinskih metrov.« Za lažjo orientacijo kolesarja na poti usmerjajo turnokolesarske ali dvonamenske markacije in usmerjevalne table z znakom Trans Karavanke, ljubitelje zbiranja žigov pa bo razveselil dnevnik te poti.Gre za dobrodošlo dopolnitev mreže turnokolesarskih poti po Sloveniji, dobršen del katere predstavlja krožna Slovenska turnokolesarska pot, ki v 41 etapah in 1850 kilometrih, ki vodijo po vseh pomembnejših gorskih skupinah, obišče 112 kontrolnih točk, med njimi več kot 50 planinskih koč, ter številne pomembne planinske in turistične znamenitosti.
Pot Trans Karavanke se razteza od Jezerskega do Tromeje oziroma Korenskega sedla.
»Turno kolesarstvo je netekmovalna zvrst gorskega kolesarstva, načrtovana vožnja po utrjenih poteh v naravnem okolju. Leta 2007 je bilo uvrščeno med planinske dejavnosti, delež planincev med člani planinske zveze, ki turno kolesarijo, pa že presega eno četrtino. Planinci postopoma urejamo tudi turnokolesarske poti, začeli smo s potjo OPD Koper Movraški krog, nato z Grosupeljsko planinsko potjo in leta 2016 s Slovensko turnokolesarsko potjo. Letos smo speljali Trans Karavanke,« je razvejanost turnega kolesarstva opisal predsednik PZS Jože Rovan, idejni oče tako slovenske turnokolesarske poti kot Trans Karavank.
text:
Cycling through the Karavanke
As part of the Alpe Adria Karavanke / Karawanken project, the Trans Karavanke Cycling Trail and the Pristava Mountain Cycling Training Center have been opened; in the cross-border area of Karawanken, an adrenaline-ridden Predigra cycle track was obtained in Žirovnica.
02 Nov 2019, 18:42 by Primoz Hieng



Along the way there are many natural and cultural sights.



PZS President Joze Rovan (center) and tour guides Andrej Remškar and Atila Armentano at the opening of the Trans Karavanke Trail



It is suitable for well-trained mountain bikers.


The new Trans-Karavanke cycle path extends from Jezersko to Tromeja or Korensko saddle, marked and also in the opposite direction. Mostly it runs along forest roads on the sunny slopes of the Karavanke Mountains, up to the ridge and the border with Austria, but only climbs at the westernmost point in Pec and Tromeja. When marking and marking trails in the field, markers of the PZS and other volunteers of local mountaineering associations appeared. Žirovnica is also looking forward to new adrenaline-filled Predigra cycling routes. The triple cycling project was created under the auspices of the three-year Alpe Adria Karavanke / Karawanken project, which brings together 12 partners, seven from Slovenia and five from Austria.


PZS President Joze Rovan (center) and tour guides Andrej Remškar and Atila Armentano at the opening of the Trans Karavanke Trail

»At 132 kilometers, which are divided into five stages, the Trans-Karavanke cycle track exceeds 5500 altitude meters. From Jezersko take us through the mountains below Košuta to Tržič, from there across Zelenica to the Završnica valley and to the mountains below Stol, continue over Jesenice via Javorniški Rovt and Planina pod Golico towards Mojstrana, and in the last part go through the Upper Sava Valley to Rateč and ascend more to Pec, ”the route was described by cycling guide Andrej Remškar. The trail also visits the Slovenian Mountaineering Museum in Mojstrana and some of the most popular mountain huts: the Dom na Kofce mountain hut, the Alpine Lodge at Zelenica, the Valvasor Lodge below Stol and the Pristava Lodge at Javorniški Rovt.
Žirovnica is looking forward to the new adrenaline-filled Predigra cycling routes.
»There are many natural and cultural sights along the way: we drive towards Tržič through the Dovžan Gorge, then through the old town center of the market, in the Završnica valley we pass by Završniški Lake, on the ascent to Zabreška planina past the Turkish Cave, near the archeological site Ajdna. Above the Planina pod Golica, one can visit the Sava Caves, and in the Upper Sava Valley, at least Zelenci, where the Sava Dolinka originates, should be mentioned. Despite all the sights, cyclists will enjoy the ultimate in views and enjoy the unspoiled nature, ”Remshkar adds.


It is suitable for well-trained mountain bikers.

“The trail is suitable for well-prepared mountain bikers, as the daily stages are generally 25 to 35 kilometers long, and at most 1650 altitudes are reached in one day.” For easier orientation, cyclists or double-purpose signposts and signboards are signposted. Trans Karavanke, whose stamp collectors will be delighted by the logbook of this trail. It is a welcome addition to the network of cycling trails in Slovenia, a good part of which is the circular Slovenian Cycling Trail, which visits 41 major stages and 1850 kilometers leading through all major mountain groups. checkpoints, including more than 50 mountain huts, as well as many important mountain and tourist attractions.
The Trans Karavanke trail extends from Jezersko to Tromeja or the Root Saddle.
»Cycling is a non-competitive type of mountain biking, planned trekking in the natural environment. In 2007, it was classified as a mountaineering activity, and the share of mountaineers among mountain biking members touring already exceeds one quarter. Mountaineers are gradually regulating the cycling trails, starting with the OPD Koper path of the Movraški krug, then the Grosupelj Mountain Trail and in 2016 the Slovenian Trail Biking Trail. This year, we launched Trans Karavanke, "described the diversity of touring cycling by PZS President Joze Rovan, the conceptual father of both the Slovenian cycling route and Trans Karavanke.
